qas.question: How was the relational model able to improve over time?

answers.text: without constant rewriting of links and pointers

qas.question: What is the relationship called in a hierarchical model?
What is the relationship called in a navigational model?
What is a third type of model that can be combined with heirarchical and navigation models?

plausible_answers.text: without constant rewriting of links and pointers

qas.question: How was the relational model able to degrade over time?
What is the only kind of relationship called?
What is the relationship that is avoided in a navigational model?
What is a third type of model that can't be combined with hierarchical and navigation models?

context: The relational model also allowed the content of the database to evolve <a0_0><b4_0>without constant rewriting of links and pointers<b4_0/><a0_0/>. The relational part comes from entities referencing other entities in what is known as <a1_0><b5_0>one-to-many<b5_0/><a1_0/> relationship, like a traditional hierarchical model, and <a2_0><b6_0>many-to-many<b6_0/><a2_0/> relationship, like a navigational (network) model. Thus, a relational model can express both hierarchical and navigational models, as well as its native <a3_0><b7_0>tabular<b7_0/><a3_0/> model, allowing for pure or combined modeling in terms of these three models, as the application requires.
